articles.title: AMD Outlook Underwhelms Investors Following AI-Fueled Rally
articles.author: Ian King
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc.'s fourth-quarter revenue will be roughly $9.6 billion. Shares fell more than 3% in extended trading following the announcement. Third-quarter sales rose 36% and profit was $1.20 a share. Data center business, the main beneficiary of AI spending, rose 22% to $4.3 billion. Personal computer-related sales rose 73%.

articles.title: Artificial General Intelligence: 9 Massive Changes AGI Will Cause
articles.author: John Koetsier
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg's new goal at Meta is to create smarter-than-humans AGI. OpenAI's charter is 'planning for AGI and beyond'. Gregory Stock argues that AGI is just the beginning of the changes AI could be bringing. He suggests that the most profound transformations caused by AGI may be within us, how humanity changes in response to AI.

articles.title: White House: No Plans to Sell Nvidia's Blackwell Chip to China—for Now
articles.summary: Nvidia's Blackwell AI chip is being developed by Annabelle Chih/Bloomberg News.    nvgo.com/blackwell AI chip. It's one of Nvidia's new AI chips. It has a built-in AI chip called Blackwell.

articles.title: Junk Food Companies Join Forces to Block Food Safety Reforms
articles.author: Matt
articles.summary: General Mills, Nestlé, Coca-Cola and other ultraprocessed food companies launched Americans for Ingredient Transparency to appear transparent while protecting their products from scrutiny. The group actively blocks state-level food safety laws and undermines the Make America Healthy Again coalition's efforts to improve the quality of the U.S. food supply.

articles.title: Coca-Cola Sparks Backlash With AI-Generated Christmas Ad, Again
articles.author: Dani Di Placido
articles.summary: Coca-Cola has released two new AI-generated Christmas ads for Christmas. Last year, the company's Christmas ads were widely criticized for being cheap and tacky. The new ads are remakes of the popular, hand-crafted ads from 1995, 'Holidays Are Coming'

articles.title: AMD Beats Earnings. The Stock Still Slides.
articles.author: Tae Kim
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices reported better-than-expected earnings results. Its shares were sliding in after-hours trading. For the September quarter, the chip maker reported adjusted earnings per share of $1.20. Revenue came in at $9.25 billion, which was ahead of analysts' expectations for $8.76 billion. CEO Lisa Su said many customers are planning 'substantially' larger CPU buildouts in the next few quarters to support higher AI demand.

articles.title: AI predicts San Antonio-area voters ‘unlikely to pass' Prop B
articles.author: Michael Karlis
articles.summary: ChatGPT predicts that Proposition B is unlikely to pass. The proposition would approve the use of county visitor tax dollars for a new Spurs arena in Bexar County, Texas. The AI points to a low voter turnout and a surge in 'yes' messaging and advertising in the days leading up to the election could sway the outcome.

articles.title: Technology, energy, and environment: How competing agendas are redefining the future
articles.author: Natural News
articles.summary: AI is replacing human jobs. 70-80% of physical labor and half of white-collar jobs will vanish by 2026, according to projections from the UNIFORC.    - see also "The Rise of AI and the Decline of Human Jobs".

articles.title: High on AI? Recruiters may check your
articles.author: Deccan Herald
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) chatbots are now available for everyday use in Bengaluru and are free for people to use. They are available on Google Play Store and on Amazon's App Store as well as on Facebook's Messenger app.    for free.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian Finds ChatGPT Blame in Law Exam Challenges: NBC10 Philadelphia Report
articles.author: Marina Collins
articles.summary: Kim Kardashian used ChatGPT as a study aid for her recent law exam, but she had problems with it. Kim Kardashian's experience raises questions about the ethical and practical implications of using AI in legal education. AI-powered study tools can be helpful, but over-reliance on them can be detrimental.

articles.title: Treeline Inc Unveils AI Powered Recruiting Playbook to Transform Sales Hiring
articles.summary: Treeline Inc. has launched its AI Recruitment Sales Hiring Playbook to help business leaders hire salespeople faster, smarter, and more predictably. The Playbook is now available for free download and companies can schedule a demo with Treeline's AI recruiting experts.

articles.title: Warriors coach Steve Kerr, OpenAI's Sam Altman discuss success, future of SF
articles.author: Pete Suratos
articles.summary: Steve Kerr and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman met in San Francisco on Monday night. They discussed the key to their success as leaders in their respective industries. They also talked about the challenges of being in positions of great influence and the responsibilities that come with that influence.

articles.title: 81% of Saudi enterprises already using industry-specific AI solutions, new SAP survey finds
articles.author: Saudi Gazette
articles.summary: Saudi businesses are embracing artificial intelligence (AI) at scale. 81% of enterprises in the Kingdom are already deploying AI solutions tailored to their industries, according to a YouGov survey commissioned by the company.       in Saudi businesses are adopting AI at a large scale.

articles.title: Coca-Cola Doubles Down on AI Holiday Ads
articles.author: John Johnson
articles.summary: Coca-Cola has created a new artificial intelligence-based holiday ad. Last year's ad didn't go over well, but this year's is better. About 30% of digital ads this year are using some form of generative AI, and that number is expected to hit 39% by 2026.

articles.title: Microsoft AI's first in-house image generator MAI-Image-1 is now available
articles.author: Elissa Welle
articles.summary: Microsoft's first in-house AI image generator, MAI-Image-1, is now available in Bing Image Creator and Copilot Audio Expressions. The text-to-image model excels at generating images of food and nature scenes, as well as artsy lighting and photorealistic detail.

articles.title: Tempus: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
articles.summary: Temporus AI Inc. (TEM) reported a loss of $80 million in its third quarter. The information in this article has been provided by STATS Perform dba Automated Insights. For copyright information, check with the distributor of this item.

articles.title: AMD reports better-than-expected results but margin guidance only meets estimates
articles.author: Jordan Novet
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices reported fiscal third-quarter results that exceeded Wall Street expectations. For the fourth quarter, AMD expects about $9.6 billion in revenue. AMD is trying to keep pace with Nvidia in the market for artificial intelligence processors. AMD reached a deal with OpenAI last month that could see the AI startup company take a 10% stake in the chipmaker.

articles.title: Introducing: Galaxy Brain Podcast
articles.author: Charlie Warzel
articles.summary: Galaxy Brain is a new video podcast launched by The Atlantic on November 14th. It will try to make sense of the online fire hose of our information ecosystem and anchor people to reality. It's a space for conversations, explanations, and tangents that anchor you to reality, no spam or slop.

articles.title: TheBestAIHumanizer.com Unveils the World's Largest AI Humanizer Benchmark – Exposing Hidden Flaws Behind 'Detector-Proof' Claims
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: ThebestaIHUMANIZER.COM announced what it calls the world's largest independent AI humanizer benchmark, a two-week, self-funded project that put seven leading AI humanizing tools through 15 real-world situations. Most online reviews follow the same script: paste one short sample and click 'humanize'.

articles.title: Pixazo Launches Free Text to Image APIs Featuring Flux, SDXL, and Stable Diffusion in Open Beta
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Pixazo's free text to image APIs give developers access to the same models powering some of the AI systems as Appy Pie's. Abhinav Girdhar is the Founder and CEO of Pixazo's parent company, AppyPie.

articles.title: AP Automation Services Help U.S. Firms Boost Vendor Collaboration with IBN Technologies
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: IBN Technologies' AP automation services are transforming U.S. healthcare and retail finance operations. They integrate AI-driven ap automation tools and accounts payable invoice automation. They improve vendor collaboration, reduce errors, and accelerate approvals. IBN Technologies' services are available in English and in Spanish.

articles.title: AMD Forecasts Q4 Revenue Above Estimates
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices forecast fourth-quarter revenue above market estimates. The company is betting on the expansion of data center infrastructure to boost demand for its artificial intelligence chips. Wall Street is betting heavily on the potential of relentless spending on advanced processors. AMD reported third-quarter sales of $9.25 billion, compared with the average estimate of $8.74 billion.

articles.title: 300 million at risk: Goldman Sachs lists top jobs that AI can replace, but plumbers ...
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Goldman Sachs predicts AI could replace work equivalent to 300 million people worldwide. Knowledge and clerical jobs will be among the first to be replaced by AI, according to the bank's research.    iReport.com: What do you think AI will replace?

articles.title: Gen Z job openings have dwindled since 2022 as AI slams entry-level roles: study
articles.author: Taylor Herzlich
articles.summary: US job postings for young adults aged 22 to 25 have plunged by 13% since 2022. IBM will lay off about 1% of its workforce in the current quarter, or approximately 2,700 jobs. Major US employers, including Amazon, UPS and Target, have cut thousands of jobs this year as they ramp up automation efforts.

articles.title: Free Year of ChatGPT Go Launched in India
articles.author: The Arabian Post
articles.summary: ChatGPT Go will be free for a 12-month period to eligible users in India starting 4 November 2025. The offer applies to new sign-ups, users on the free tier and existing users. It applies only to the mid-tier subscription plan.

articles.title: Automation Anywhere Buying Aisera To Advance The Autonomous Enterprise Era
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Automation Anywhere has announced the acquisition of Aisera, a top provider of agentic AI solutions for autonomous IT. The deal unites two pioneers in automation and conversational AI to create the industry's most complete agentic automation platform. It is expected to enhance human work, reduce operational costs, increase speed, and improve customer satisfaction.

articles.title: Lay intuition as effective at jailbreaking AI chatbots as technical methods, research suggests
articles.author: Francisco Tutella
articles.summary: A competition called "Bias-a-Thon" challenged participants to come up with prompts that would lead generative AI systems to respond with biased answers. The researchers found that the intuitive strategies employed by everyday internet users were just as effective at inducing biased responses as expert technical strategies.

articles.title: Australia Is Facing an ‘AI Divide', New National Survey Shows
articles.summary: OpenAI launched ChatGPT in November 2022. Generative artificial intelligence (AI) products have become increasingly ubiquitous and advanced. AI products can generate text, but they can also generate anything from a picture to a speech.      Â

articles.title: AMD forecasts fourth-quarter revenue above estimates
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices forecast fourth-quarter revenue above market estimates. The company expects revenue of about $9.6 billion for the quarter, plus or minus $300 million. Wall Street is betting heavily on the potential of relentless spending on advanced processors. AMD's shares have more than doubled in value this year.

articles.title: Man charged in one of South Carolina's first AI child sexual abuse material cases
articles.author: Alyse Rhue
articles.summary: Adam Asad Kelton, 25, was arrested on Thursday on two counts of possessing a visual depiction or representation of a minor engaging in sexually explicit conduct, a felony punishable by up to 10 years in prison for each count. This will be one of the first cases under the state's new statute criminalizing such material.

articles.title: Skills Crisis Intensifies as AI Reshapes Workplace
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is changing the rules of work and American employees are struggling to keep up. 42% of employees expect their roles will evolve significantly within the next year. 32% of workers feel increased pressure to learn workplace skills because of AI, up from 26% last year.

articles.title: AI assistant developed for every step of the scientific process
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: Researchers have developed an AI-powered 'scientific assistant' designed to help people with scientific problems. It is powered by artificial intelligence. It can be controlled by an app or by a computer. It's called 'Scientific Assistant' and it has a built-in voice control.

articles.title: I mean, it's not like this guy has been right about major crashes in the past or anything, has he?
articles.author: Asa Phelps
articles.summary: DrD'isInfotainment, Marcus Aurelius, SpectroBoy, Irving Maimway, Fasces Breaker, Princess Celestia, and Sgarri7777 are discussing AI. They think AI is a fad built on stolen data and it will crash.

articles.title: I let Gemini watch my family for the weekend — it got weird
articles.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
articles.summary: Gemini for Home AI is a new AI that interprets Google's Nest cameras and gives a written description of the events in the Google Home app. It's available in early access and costs $20 per month or $200 per year Google Home Premium Advanced subscription, which includes 24/7 video recording.

articles.title: Cartoon: Give me your grid!
articles.author: David Horsey
articles.summary: A cartoon by David Horsey shows the dark reality of making the US the AI capital of the world and the rise of artificial intelligence in the U.S. It's not going to be good for the country's economy, but it will be better for the world.

articles.title: In A Six-Month Experiment, This Guy Trusted ChatGPT To Invest $100 For Him. Currently, He's Turning A Profit.
articles.author: Kyra Piperides
articles.summary: Nathan Smith invested $100 in ChatGPT as part of a 6-month experiment to see if an AI could work the stock market to turn a profit. It has already turned a 25% profit, effectively earning him $25 from his $100 investment.

articles.title: Lucasys Releases Agentic AI, Supercharging its Income Tax Suite
articles.author: Lucasys
articles.summary: Lucasys AI is an interactive, agentic artificial intelligence platform built specifically for tax professionals. It extends the functionality of each of the applications within the Lucasys Income Tax Suite and empowers organizations to make faster, smarter decisions. It goes beyond simple automation and offers meaningful insights, intuitive navigation and a new level of efficiency.

articles.title: AI reshapes wealth advisory as trust, personalisation and succession planning take centre stage
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is redefining how advisers engage with clients and deliver personalised financial guidance. AI is more than a tool, it's a mindset shift for wealth management industry professionals.       .   "Artificial Intelligence is a transformative force in wealth management"

articles.title: Lawmakers want Ohio bill to penalize AI companies when chatbots promote self-harm
articles.author: Anna Staver
articles.summary: Lawmakers want to hold the companies behind artificial intelligence chatbots that suggest harmful behaviors liable. House Bill 524 would give Ohio's Attorney General the authority to investigate these situations, issue cease-and-desist orders and bring civil actions for penalties of up to $50,000 per violation. Money collected would go to the 988 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Fund.

articles.title: How AI personas could be used to detect human deception
articles.author: Paige Higley
articles.summary: A study by Michigan State University and the University of Oklahoma looked at how well AI can understand humans and detect human deception. It found that AI is more lie-biased and less accurate than humans. The industry needs to make significant progress before generative AI can be used for deception detection.

articles.title: UC invites students, faculty, staff to present at AI symposium (University of Cincinnati)
articles.author: Public Technologies
articles.summary: Submit your proposal by Nov. 21 for UC conference on AI and Emerging Technology by Emily Baute. Bearcats AI Ready! Powering the Future of Work, Research, and Learning is published by UC Press on November 4th, 2025. It's a book about the Bearcats and AI.

articles.title: Toronto's Beacon Software Raises US$250-Million to Accelerate AI Roll-up Strategy
articles.author: Mail
articles.summary: Beacon Software has closed $250 million in Series B financing to purchase smaller, niche software and services firms and embed artificial intelligence into them. The AI holding company claims to have already acquired and partnered with dozens of companies since its launch last year. More than 30 percent of them are in education, finance, logistics and recreation.

articles.title: SMBs Seeing Revenue Boost with AI Search
articles.summary: SMBs Seeing Revenue Boost with AI Search, but most still block AI crawlers. Many SMBs benefit from AI-powered search and chatbots, with 44 percent reporting more leads, 42 percent more website traffic, and 33 percent more inquiries. More than half of SMBs block the crawlers, mainly over content ownership and intellectual property.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 12:36 p.m. EST
articles.author: Citizen Tribune
articles.summary: OpenAI and Amazon sign a $38 billion deal for AI computing power for AI technology. The deal includes both AI and machine learning capabilities.      Â   for Amazon and OpenAI to work together on AI technology for the next decade.

articles.title: What is ‘chatfishing'? The AI dating trend explained & if LGBTQ+ folks are guilty of doing it
articles.author: Ariel Messman-Rucker
articles.summary: 'Chatfishing' is a new dating app trend where people use AI chatbots to create their messages on dating apps. It's like catfishing on steroids, because it tricks people into believing they're talking directly to someone they're interested in dating, when in reality they're flirting with and getting to know ChatGPT instead of making a genuine connection with another person. According to Taryn Sinclaire, a trans woman and trauma-focused therapist, and Dylan Thomas Cotter, an author, trans activist, former adult entertainer, Scruff dating app ambassador, and author, LGBTQ+ daters are more likely to experience it.

articles.title: The legal reality of fake images: What New York's new laws mean for you
articles.author: Andrew Denney
articles.summary: A deepfake is an image or recording that has been convincingly altered and manipulated to misrepresent someone as doing or saying something that was not actually done or said. New York has moved to update its criminal laws to address deepfakes. The law treats AI-generated images the same way as real, non-consensual intimate photos.

articles.title: Review: Post reporters date Grok sexbots Valentine and Ani
articles.author: Asia Grace
articles.summary: AI chatbot Valentine seduced Post reporter Asia Grace into a steamy relationship with him on the Grok chat app. The market for AI chatbots is predicted to balloon to $4.8 trillion by 2033.    AI Journal rated Candy AI the No. 1 'NSFW AI companion platform in 2025'

articles.title: How will AI impact jobs?
articles.author: Al Jazeera
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is already weaving into virtually every industry and beginning to reshape how we work. Many professionals are now asking what it means for their careers. AI is changing the way we work and it is reshaping how we think about the future of work.

articles.title: AIQ enters Indonesia through strategic agreement with SKK Migas
articles.author: The Gulf Time
articles.summary: SKK Migas and Wamaiq, the Abu Dhabi-based artificial intelligence (AI) pioneer focused on transforming the energy sector, have partnered with the Special Task Force for Upstream Oil and Gas Business Activities of the Republic of Indonesia.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian blames ChatGPT for failing her law exams
articles.author: NBC News
articles.summary: Kim Kardashian used ChatGPT to help her study for her exams in law school when she was in school. Kim Kardashian doesn't like using online learning tools as they're always wrong.   Â      in the end, she finds them useless.

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: AI set to help decide local government reorganisation
articles.summary: Ministers warned AI cannot replace 'robust' analysis. Whitehall planning to use the technology to help decide local government reorganisation, but it's not ready for prime ministerial use at the moment, as it's considered too expensive.    for ministers.

articles.title: AI and the Coming White-Collar Political Upheaval
articles.author: William A. Galston
articles.summary: Americans are realizing that artificial intelligence can revolutionize the economy, society and politics. Four of America's largest tech firms have had capital expenditures of $360 billion over the past year. OpenAI last month completed its transition from a for-profit to a public-benefit corporation.

articles.title: Stanford Study Finds AI Chatbots Struggle to Separate Fact from Belief
articles.summary: Stanford University researchers tested 24 large language models, including GPT-4o and DeepSeek, through 13,000 questions. They found that AI chatbots struggle to distinguish between true and false beliefs when responding to first-person statements like "I believe that..."

articles.title: How to Capitalize on Digital Transformation? the Answer Is in Ai
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (IA) is transforming Meta's relationship with companies in Mexico. AI business solutions are maximizing investment returns in Latin America. Advertisers who adopted AI-driven segmentation functions are experiencing a 17% increase in the Return of Advertising Investment (ROAS).

articles.title: Cornell professor develops AI system that sees, hears and feels
articles.author: Autriya Maneshni
articles.summary: Cornell University professor Andrew Owens is developing artificial intelligence that can see, hear and feel. His system will learn through multiple senses, similar to how a child explores the world by picking up objects and putting them in their mouths and mimicking their parents' mouth movements.

articles.title: Lawmakers seek to ban AI models that encourage physical harm
articles.author: Danny Eldredge
articles.summary: House Bill 524 would ban people from developing or deploying artificial intelligence models that encourage users to physically harm themselves or others. The bill is sponsored by state Rep. Ty Mathews (R., Findlay). Adam Raine, 16, died by suicide after a chatbot provided him with detailed instructions on how to take his own life.

articles.title: More and more people are using ChatGPT for psychological support, but what do psychologists think? 'The possibilities are endless'
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an AI-powered support system developed by Anne-Françoise Meulemans, a psychotherapist at CentrEmergence. She uses it to help her patients with introversion, social anxiety, or feelings of submissiveness. She believes ChatGPT will not replace the human connection inherent in therapy.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Reshapes Global Real Estate Marketing Race
articles.summary: Laurie Andrews is President of Cotton & Company, a Florida based agency recognized as one of the nation's leading luxury real estate marketing firms. Her LinkedIn article series explores how Artificial Intelligence is influencing discovery, marketing, and buyer behavior in the real estate industry.

articles.title: Perplexity AI accuses Amazon of bullying with legal threat over Comet browser
articles.author: Ashley Capoot
articles.summary: Perplexity AI accused Amazon of bullying them over its artificial intelligence browser Comet. Amazon wants to prevent Comet users from using it to make purchases on their behalf. Amazon has already taken steps in recent months to prevent external AI agents from crawling its website. Amazon did not immediately respond to CNBC's request for comment.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian Blames ChatGPT for Failing Law Exams
articles.author: Julia Reinstein
articles.summary: Kim Kardashian completed her law program in May and took the bar exam two months later. She uses chatbot ChatGPT to get legal advice, but it has often steered her wrong and made her fail tests. She's expecting her bar exam results in a few days.

articles.title: Cramd Expands AI Study Platform with Adaptive Learning to Personalize How Students Learn
articles.author: Get News
articles.summary: Cramd has launched Adaptive Learning, a new AI feature that personalizes study paths for every learner. The update combines Cramd's PDF summarizer, Quizlet import tool and AI flashcard maker into one adaptive platform that adjusts question difficulty, review timing and content pacing in real time.

articles.title: The Innovation of AI Promo – [your]NEWS
articles.author: Shawn Cunningham
articles.summary: Shawn Cunningham is a correspondent for yourNEWS in Presque Isle, Maine. Shawn launched a new digital media career after 22 years as a multiple award-winning television news producer/Anchor/Reporter. Shawn is launching a new career path & partnership with yourNEWS as a news correspondent for "yourNEWS Maine" and 'yourNEWS: National".

articles.title: ‘I'll get mad and I'll yell at it': Kim Kardashian blames failing law exam on studying with ChatGPT
articles.author: Akim Powell
articles.summary: Kardashian uses ChatGPT chatbot for legal advice, but she doesn't consider it a friend. She took the law exam in July 2025 and the results are expected to be released on Nov. 7. The lie detector test operator found that Kardashian was not lying about her ChatGpt usage.

articles.title: Rise of the AI Job-Killing Machines
articles.author: Variety
articles.summary: AI will probably cause some layoffs in corporate America, but it's unlikely to eliminate most jobs outright. Instead, it's more likely to transform the nature of many roles and reshape the workforce over time. OpenAI's ChatGPT chatbot says this.

articles.title: Perplexity responds to Amazon's threats over AI shopping assistants
articles.author: Vlad Schepkov
articles.summary: Perplexity AI has received a legal threat from Amazon. Amazon wants Perplexity's AI agents to stop using them to make purchases on its website. The AI company defended its Comet Assistant feature, which allows users to find and purchase items on Amazon when logged in. Amazon prioritizes advertising revenue over user experience.

articles.title: Amandeep Kumar wins new Amazon AI PhD Fellowship
articles.author: Arun Kumar
articles.summary: Amandeep Kumar is an Indian American Electrical and Computer Engineering PhD student at Johns Hopkins University. He studies computer vision and generative AI with the aim of enhancing the efficiency of long-form video generation. Johns Hopkins is one of nine universities selected by Amazon for its new AI PhD Fellowship program. The program will provide nearly $68 million in funding over two years to more than 100 doctoral students nationwide.

articles.title: OpenAI launches its Sora app on Android
articles.author: Emma Roth
articles.summary: OpenAI has brought its AI video app, Sora, to Android. The app is now available on the Google Play Store in the US, Canada, Japan, Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam. OpenAI launched the app on iOS in September, with the app accumulating more than 1 million downloads in the five days.

articles.title: Why Being Small Is Suddenly The Ultimate AI Advantage
articles.author: Arafat Kabir
articles.summary: In the AI arms race, the little guys are winning. McKinsey found 78% of organizations now use AI but only 1% describe their rollouts as 'mature'. Only 6% of the organizations reported return on investment under a year. The successful 5% share three characteristics: weaponize their data, cultivate leadership cultures and train their people.

articles.title: Perplexity says ‘will not be intimidated' by Amazon
articles.author: Tip Ranks
articles.summary: Perplexity received a legal threat from Amazon. Amazon wants to ban Comet users from using their AI assistants on Amazon. This is Amazon's first legal salvo against an AI company. It's a bully tactic to scare disruptive companies like Perplexity out of making life better for people.

articles.title: Why AI's Next Breakthrough May Come From Games
articles.author: Shaw Walters
articles.summary: Some researchers believe the next breakthrough in AI design will come from learning through games. The modern AI industry owes a lot to games. AIs can be placed in 'toy worlds' with goals, boundaries and social rules for them to learn from. The real test of intelligence is the ability to adapt.

articles.title: Smarter AI models show more selfish behavior
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: As artificial intelligence systems become more capable of complex reasoning, they tend to act more selfishly. In one experiment, simply adding five or six reasoning steps cut cooperation nearly in half, according to the researchers.       .   i   "

articles.title: Rambus Stock: AI Data Center Play Vaults 117%, Tests Key Level
articles.author: VIDYA RAMAKRISHNAN
articles.summary: Rambus is Tuesday's selection for IBD 50 Stocks To Watch. The AI data-center stock was down nearly 9% on Oct. 28. Rambus makes chips that improve data bandwidth and capacity. Its products also help with cloud security for data centers. Institutional investors have been net buyers of the AI chip stock over the past 13 weeks.

articles.title: Study: AI can use smartwatch data to detect heart disease
articles.author: Dennis Thompson
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can use smartwatch data to detect heart disease. The findings will be presented Friday at the American Heart Association's annual meeting in New Orleans. The AI was 88% accurate at distinguishing between people with or without heart disease based on the data from an Apple Watch.

articles.title: Right-Wing Chatbots Turbocharge America's Political and Cultural Wars
articles.summary: A new generation of chatbots claim to be better sources of facts than humans. The New York Times tested several of them and found that they produced starkly different answers, especially on politically charged issues. Oren Etzioni, professor emeritus at the University of Washington and founder of TrueMedia.org, believes that people will choose their sources of information based on their political leanings.

articles.title: UKG Launches Workforce Intelligence Hub, Redefining Workforce Operations and Unlocking Unmatched Labor Insights
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: UKG Aspire 2025 unveiled the Workforce Intelligence Hub, a first-of-its-kind AI-driven solution that unifies all workforce information into one real-time view. UKG is a leading global AI platform unifying HR, pay, and workforce management.

articles.title: Alabama HBCU Miles College and NVIDIA Corporation to form AI partnership
articles.author: Barnett Wright
articles.summary: Miles College will collaborate with NVIDIA Corporation to integrate AI across academic programs, faculty research and community engagement on the Fairfield campus. NVIDIA is investing more than $100 billion globally in artificial intelligence. It will provide access to resources, frameworks and development tools to expand the HBCU's AI curriculum and train and certify faculty and students in AI and accelerated computing. The company will also work with Miles College to identify and position resources and partnerships to catalyze innovation and economic development for surrounding communities.

articles.title: Alarming study shows ChatGPT confuses fact and fiction — and users are none the wiser: ‘Serious errors in judgment'
articles.author: Ben Cost
articles.summary: Stanford University researchers found that AI chatbots like ChatGPT struggle to distinguish between belief and fact. The study was published in the journal Nature Machine Intelligence. It has worrying ramifications given the tech's increased omnipresence in sectors such as law, medicine and journalism.

articles.title: Legal Restrictions: Hiring a Content Writer to Create Custom Content
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: SEO is the process of enhancing your website to achieve higher rankings in search engine results pages. According to Statista, over 93% of online experiences begin with a search engine. Mobile-first indexing means Google primarily uses the mobile version of a website for indexing and ranking.

articles.title: The top 5 myths about AI in video debunked
articles.author: Hope Horner
articles.summary: AI is changing how video gets made. It's speeding up tedious tasks and unlocking new creative possibilities, but it also has real limitations. Editors are using AI to shave time off the repetitive parts of the job so they can put more energy into creative and strategic work. AI doesn't make video production free, it shifts the work.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian blames ChatGPT for failing her law exams
articles.author: Adrianne Reece
articles.summary: Kim Kardashian graduated from her law program in May. She used ChatGPT to help her study for her school exams, but it steered her in the wrong direction. She will be qualified in two weeks. She hopes to practice law in the next 10 years. She is busy filming "All's Fair" with Teyana Taylor and Sarah Paulson.

articles.title: Chatbot Correspondence Invades the Letters to the Editor Page
articles.author: New York Times
articles.summary: The rise of artificial intelligence has produced serial writers to science and medical journals. They are probably trying to boost the number of citations they've published, as they do not need to earn a lot of money on the work they do. They want to be better known.

articles.title: Commentary: AI's free ride on creative labor is undermining the marketplace
articles.author: The Brunswick News
articles.summary: Some of the most prominent players in artificial intelligence are taking what isn't theirs and selling it as their own. OpenAI's new 'Sora' is an example of such a practice.
